text:
only on sega master/game gear version & no its not just N.america but also europe & japan as well.

the genesis/mega drive version had the basic robotnik from sonic 1,2, & 3. well except he's kinda little off in the game but still.

also the genesis/mega drive version is more based on the sonic SATAM or the comic series while the master system/game gear version is more based on the AOSTH series.

text:
@mustpickname To be fair, it wasn't what Colors started fixing so much as what Unleashed started fixing - while the Night stages in Unleashed were terrible, the day stages are what Generations' Modern stages are closest to in terms of design and play, and really did mark a turning point for the series.

Either way, yes, SupraDarky, go play Generations or at least go get the soundtrack because oh my god.

text: It's always nice to see that someone else played the Game Gear games.
author: jdng86

text:
Good lord, why did they ever get rid of Fang?
Worse yet, why'd they replace him with Rouge? I don't buy that whole "fang was too vampiric" argument of theirs, considering Rouge is every single definition of vampiric. Vampire Bat, bossy, manipulative, cunning, using charms to get her way. Fang just a big tooth, so what? Knuckles has FANGS FOR GOD'S SAKE and they kept him!
On said note, what happened to Mighty? They kept Charmy, but left out Mighty? Again, what gives?
author: Arc13

text: @SupraDarky Highly suggest it. I cleared it quickly, but that's not where the vast meat exists, it's in actually completing everything. (Plus it's Sonic, everything's gonna be quick). It admittingly doesn't pay as much tribute to the past as it lets on(only classic characters are Sonic, Tails, and Robotnik). With only the first 3 genesis games covered. Still nice to make up for a lot of the other games by making same levels, but vastly improved. Loads of nostalgia, loads of fun, go get it.
author: Arc13

text: @SupraDarky It was Indeed really good.

author: GameMasterGuy

text: @GameMasterGuy ...invincibility is flying as Modern Sonic, which is pretty useless and eats rings like there's no tomorrow.
author: GameMasterGuy

text: @SupraDarky It's the best Sonic ever, and I've played them all, spinoffs aside (though I have played plenty of them). Only three problems: 1) It's short. As in, 4 hour short. 100%ing is taking much longer though, as there's 10 red rings and 10 challenge missions per level. 2) Final boss sucks. It's not hard, just boring and doesn't explain itself very well gameplay wise. 3)  Super Sonic sucks. It's barely faster than Sonic with a couple speed upgrades, and its only special ability besides...
author: GameMasterGuy

text: And suddenly this VGM list has become inspiring again. Seems like the music on the Sonic Game Gear games is very underrated, there are great classics like Scrap Brain and Labyrinth Zone, both miles ahead of their 16 bit counterparts...
